page.title: 08TRADE
page.content: The block contains two shops; both are Post Offices. In Bulkington only sweets and cigarettes are sold; Keevil has grocery items.Gwen and Max Propert have run the business since Gwen began a PO and stores at 78 Main Street in l940. In 1959 they moved to the old Rose & Crown pub, their present prem- ises, and became the only shop in the area with an off-licence.Until the 60s Keevil also sustained another shop, begun in 1925 as a PO in the present Old Bakery. This past trade has dim- inished to loyal skeleton support for the remaining shop. Mobile trade serv- ing the villages includes a fish and chip van, fresh fish van, hairdresser and shop. There is a small-scale sale of goods under party-plan schemes and by an Avon make-up agent. Bulkington Ushers pub formerly The Bell, renamed Well Inn caters mainly for local trade
